sentence.Network_en: Today a resurgent, confident and globalising China is rebuilding its naval strength.
sentence.Network_cn: 今天,一个复兴的, 充满自信的,全球化中的中国正在重建她的海军力量.

sentence.Network_en: This was an extraordinary concession for a proud, resurgent nation.
sentence.Network_cn: 对一个自尊自大 、 日益复兴的国家来说,这是相当大的让步.

sentence.Network_en: Dr. DeLay cautioned countries to maintain against resurgent pandemic.
sentence.Network_cn: 戴雷尔告诫各国应保持警惕,以防艾滋病的蔓延势头再度转强.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent. (earlier as a noun): from Latin resurgent- 'rising again', from the verb resurgere, from re- 'again' + surgere 'to rise'

entry.tran: 重新兴起的;复兴的,复苏的
entry.def: You use resurgent to say that something is becoming stronger and more popular after a period when it has been weak and unimportant.

example.ex: ...the threat from the resurgent nationalist movement.
example.tran: 重新兴起的民族主义运动的威胁

means.word_mean: 1. rising again as to new life and vigor;

stems_affixes.word_buile: in内部+surgent[adj.澎湃的,汹涌的]→adj.起义的
re再次+surg升起+ent……的→再次升起来→恢复的
surge[n.&v.巨涌, 汹涌, 澎湃]+ent……的→adj.澎湃的,汹涌的
